title: Mass. ACA exchange begins to estimate skyrocketing premiums ahead of 2026
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Democratic lawmakers are pushing to pass extensions of tax credits, which make health care cheaper for millions of Americans and expire at the end of the year.
Massachusetts Health Connector Executive Director Audrey Morse Gasteier poses for a portrait in the state health insurance marketplace's office Tuesday, July 2, 2025, in Boston.

title: Boston man facing animal cruelty charges for whipping, dragging dog, claims he was pet-sitting
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The man told law enforcement that he was pet-sitting the dog and was trying to train it, and further alleged that the dog bit him.
A Boston man is facing animal cruelty charges after he allegedly mistreated a dog he claimed to be pet-sitting, prosecutors said.

Akeem Pierre, 42, was charged Thursday in the Dorchester division of Boston Municipal Court with animal cruelty and animal cruelty by custodian, according to the Suffolk County District Attorney’s Office.

title: What have Patriots coaches told Drake Maye about sliding, avoiding injuries?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “He’s a competitive guy.
I think certainly making sure he’s available to the team is a priority.
" Drake Maye avoided an injury during Sunday's win over the Titans.

title: Mass. hospitals hit by cyberattack that caused network outage
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Health Both of the affected hospitals are owned and managed by Heywood Medical Group, a non-profit physician organization.
Two Massachusetts hospitals are still reeling from a network outage last week that was later discovered to be caused by a cyberattack.
Heywood Hospital in Gardner, which has 134 beds, and Athol Hospital in Athol, which has 25 beds, first reported being impacted by the outage Oct.

title: Josh McDaniels explains TreVeyon Henderson’s limited snaps with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “Everybody wants to point out this block or that block, or what have you.
" TreVeyon Henderson logged just nine snaps on Sunday against the Titans.

(AP Photo/John Amis) TreVeyon Henderson was arguably the star of the Patriots’ training camp and preseason slate, with the 2025 second-round pick out of Ohio State looking like a dynamic playmaker on what was once a listless New England offense.

title: Former White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre declares herself ‘Independent’
author: Blake Maddux
bullets: Books The former White House Press Secretary discusses her frustration with the current state of both her former political home and the two-party system itself in her new book.
File - Karine Jean-Pierre during a press briefing in the White House in 2022.

title: Former MLB GM believes Red Sox will likely trade Jarren Duran this offseason
author: Conor Ryan

title: Report exposes culture of hazing and humiliation at Cape Cod police academy
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News The East Falmouth Police Academy opened its doors in January.
By March, academy leadership had been suspended and all staff instructors temporarily removed.
The Municipal Police Training Committee hosted an unrelated training session in Andover in 2023.
